concept.title: Case 6: Policy based on device type (for example, device model)

section.title: Overview
section.p: This use case demonstrates the ability of NCC to provide policy rules related to User Equipment (UE) type.

ul.li: Simulate attachment for a device with TAC different than 35325801 to verify that NCC returns same QoS as sent in CCR-I PCC Base rule default-crbn-ir.
Simulate attachment for a device with TAC is 35325801 to verify that NCC returns PCC Base rule base name restrictTAC-crbn.

note.p: Ensure that after creating a record, you distribute it to ME. Otherwise, the provisioning will not be successful.

ol.li: Create the custom data TAClist. To do this, log into the SM GUI and navigate to Subscriber Manager and select Custom Data tab. Click to create a custom data as shown in the following figure:

Create a device and add the custom attribute TAClist with integer 35325801. To do this, log into the SM GUI and navigate to Subscriber Manager and select Devices tab. Click to create a device.
Add the basic data for device, click continue and click ADD CUSTOM DATA and add the custom attribute as shown in the following figure:

Create a predefined PCC rule: restrictTac-crbn. To do this, log into the SM GUI and navigate to Policy & Charging Configuration and select Policy tab. Select Network Rule Templates from the drop-down list. Click to create a PCC rule.
Note: Use the Rule System Version created already following the steps mentioned in the
section.
